newsitem.title: UK: EMI rebounds from recent tumble.
newsitem.headline: EMI rebounds from recent tumble.

text.p: Shares in music publisher EMI Group Plc rose on Tuesday as recent sharp declines sparked a bout of bargain-hunting in the stock, dealers said.

"Quite a lot of buyers jumped in and squeezed up the market," said a market-maker at one leading brokerage. "Everyone just came in trying to pick up cheap stock. It got overdone this morning." Said another: "The bounce was due to a two-pound drop last week. Buyers are looking for value now. This is just a rally."
EMI shares, which earlier fell as low as 1083 stg -- their lowest in 18 months -- were up 29p at 11.30 stg by 1059 stg.
"At some stage there was always going to be a technical bounce in the shares," said another dealer. "It wouldn't surprise me if we saw a rally back up to say 11.70 stg."
EMI shares have fallen sharply in the past two weeks, as long-standing worries over the state of the music market have been joined by negative comment from analysts at Schroder Securities.
Starting coverage of EMI with an "underperform" rating, Schroders said the stock should be sold down to 10.00 stg.
